sense.name: the act of revealing formerly secret information
sense.commentary: DISCLOSURE[+event][+communication][+speech_act][+revealing][+information][+secret] Note: implies an agent in the act of communicating Note: the DISCLOSURE of Y -> X DISCLOSES Y
sense.examples: The judge ordered the disclosure of the government documents. The disclosure of a terrorist plot by a man in custody has led to several more arrests.

sense.name: information content that was secret, but now revealed
sense.commentary: DISCLOSURE[+entity][+symbolic][+information][+secret][+revealed] Note: refers to the content of the information, not the act of communicating by an agent
sense.examples: These shocking disclosures of infidelity in the papers are ruining the politician's career. Among the stolen documents may have been disclosures of new weapon technology.
